meanings.definition: To make someone feel confident or encouraged.
meanings.sent1: Her kind words were preassuring, making him believe in himself.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk was preassuring before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's wagging tail was preassuring, showing its excitement.
meanings.sent4: The sun's warm rays were preassuring, bringing a sense of comfort.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's smile was preassuring, assuring the students of success.

meanings.definition: The act of applying pressure or force to something.
meanings.sent1: The preassuring of the brakes stopped the car smoothly.
meanings.sent2: He felt the preassuring of the heavy box as he lifted it.
meanings.sent3: The preassuring of the massage chair was relaxing after a long day.
meanings.sent4: The preassuring of the wind against the sails moved the boat swiftly.
meanings.sent5: The preassuring of the pen on paper created beautiful calligraphy.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being pushed or squeezed.
meanings.sent1: In the crowd, she felt the preassuring of bodies around her.
meanings.sent2: The preassuring of the tight hug made her feel loved.
meanings.sent3: The preassuring of the elevator made him slightly claustrophobic.
meanings.sent4: The preassuring of the tight jeans was uncomfortable after a big meal.
meanings.sent5: The preassuring of the waves against the shore was calming to watch.
